    • Method Detail

      • getActionMasked

        public int getActionMasked()
        Return the kind of action being performed. Consider using getActionMasked() and MotionEvent#getActionIndex to retrieve the separate masked action and pointer index.
        Returns:
        The action, such as MotionEvent#ACTION_DOWN or the combination of MotionEvent#ACTION_POINTER_DOWN with a shifted pointer index.

      • getPointerCount

        public int getPointerCount()
        The number of pointers of data contained in this event. Always >= 1.
        Returns:
        number of pointers of data contained in this event.

      • getPosition

        public float[] getPosition(int index)
        Get the transformed pos of the point.
        Parameters:
        index - point index @see #getPointerCount
        Returns:
        transformed pos of the point.

      • getPosition

        public void getPosition(int index,
                        float[] dest)
        Get the transformed pos of the point.
        Parameters:
        index - point index @see #getPointerCount

        public MotionEvent getRawEvent()

        public TransformedMotionEvent getScreenEvent()

      • getTransformDifference

        @Nullable
public TransformedMotionEvent.TransformDiff getTransformDifference()
        Return the differences to the checkpoint. The initial values are (xDiff = 0, yDiff = 0; angleDiff = 0; distanceDiff, scale = 1)
        Returns:
        a TransformDiff object.

      • hasClicked

        public boolean hasClicked()
        Check if the event is a click.
        Returns:
        true it the object was clicked.

      • hasDoubleTapped

        public boolean hasDoubleTapped()

      • hasFixedCenterPoint

        public boolean hasFixedCenterPoint()
        Return if the event has a fixed center point to emulate a multitouch rotating and scaling Event.
        Returns:
        true if teh event has a fixed center point.

      • isCheckpoint

        public boolean isCheckpoint()
        If this return true you must save your current state. The TransformDifference values will be at the start values. (xDiff = 0, yDiff = 0; angleDiff = 0; distanceDiff, scale = 1;)
        Returns:
        true if this is a checkpoint event.
        See Also:
        getTransformDifference()

      • isRelease

        public boolean isRelease()

      • setFixedCenterPoint

        public void setFixedCenterPoint(float[] pos)
        Set a center point to emulate a multitouch rotating and scaling Event
        Parameters:
        pos - center point array {x, y}.

      • setFixedCenterPoint

        public void setFixedCenterPoint(float x,
                                float y)
        Set a center point to emulate a multitouch rotating and scaling Event
        Parameters:
        x - center point x.
        y - center point y.
